com.github.davidmoten.rx.jdbc

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.davidmoten.rx.jdbc.Database

  • public final class Database
extends Object
    Main entry point for manipulations of a database using rx-java-jdbc style queries.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database(ConnectionProvider cp,
        rx.functions.Func0<rx.Scheduler> nonTransactionalSchedulerFactory)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        cp - provides connections
        nonTransactionalSchedulerFactory - schedules non transactional queries

      • Database

        public Database(ConnectionProvider cp)
        Constructor. Thread pool size defaults to Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors()+1. This may be too conservative if the database is on another server. If that is the case then you may want to use a thread pool size equal to the available processors + 1 on the database server.
        Parameters:
        cp - provides connections

      • Database

        public Database(String url)
        Constructor. Uses a ConnectionProviderFromUrl based on the given url.
        Parameters:
        url - jdbc connection url

      • Database

        public Database(Connection con)
        Constructor. Uses the single connection provided and current thread scheduler (trampoline) to run all queries. The connection will not be closed in reality though the log may indicate it as having received a close call.
        Parameters:
        con - the connection

      • from

        public static Database from(Connection con)
        Factory method. Uses the single connection provided and current thread scheduler (trampoline) to run all queries. The connection will not be closed in reality though the log may indicate it as having received a close call.
        Parameters:
        con - the connection

      • builder

        public static Database.Builder builder()
        Returns a new Database.Builder.
        Returns:

      • queryContext

        public com.github.davidmoten.rx.jdbc.QueryContext queryContext()
        Returns the thread local current query context (will not return null). Will return overriden context (for example using Database returned from beginTransaction() if set.
        Returns:

      • select

        public QuerySelect.Builder select(String sql)
        Returns a QuerySelect.Builder builder based on the given select statement sql.
        Parameters:
        sql - a select statement.
        Returns:
        select query builder

      • update

        public QueryUpdate.Builder update(String sql)
        Returns a QueryUpdate.Builder builder based on the given update/insert/delete/DDL statement sql.
        Parameters:
        sql - an update/insert/delete/DDL statement.
        Returns:
        update/insert query builder

      • beginTransaction

        public rx.Observable<Boolean> beginTransaction(rx.Observable<?> dependency)
        Starts a transaction. Until commit() or rollback() is called on the source this will set the query context for all created queries to be a single threaded executor with one (new) connection.
        Parameters:
        dependency -
        Returns:

      • beginTransaction

        public rx.Observable<Boolean> beginTransaction()
        Starts a transaction. Until commit() or rollback() is called on the source this will set the query context for all created queries to be a single threaded executor with one (new) connection.
        Returns:

      • commit

        public rx.Observable<Boolean> commit(rx.Observable<?>... depends)
        Commits a transaction and resets the current query context so that further queries will use the asynchronous version by default. All Observable dependencies must be complete before commit is called.
        Parameters:
        depends - depdencies that must complete before commit occurs.
        Returns:

      • commitOperator

        public <T> rx.Observable.Operator<Boolean,T> commitOperator()
        Waits for the source to complete before returning the result of db.commit();
        Returns:
        commit operator

      • rollbackOperator

        public <T> rx.Observable.Operator<Boolean,T> rollbackOperator()
        Waits for the source to complete before returning the result of db.rollback();
        Returns:
        rollback operator

      • rollback

        public rx.Observable<Boolean> rollback(rx.Observable<?>... depends)
        Rolls back a transaction and resets the current query context so that further queries will use the asynchronous version by default. All Observable dependencies must be complete before rollback is called.
        Parameters:
        depends - depdencies that must complete before commit occurs.
        Returns:

      • lastTransactionResult

        public rx.Observable<Boolean> lastTransactionResult()
        Returns observable that emits true when last transaction committed or false when last transaction is rolled back.
        Returns:

      • close

        public Database close()
        Close the database in particular closes the ConnectionProvider for the database. For a ConnectionProviderPooled this will be a required call for cleanup.
        Returns:

      • commitOnCompleteOperator

        public <T> rx.Observable.Operator<Boolean,T> commitOnCompleteOperator()
        Commits current transaction on the completion of source if and only if the source sequence is non-empty.
        Returns:
        operator that commits on completion of source.

      • rollbackOnCompleteOperator

        public <T> rx.Observable.Operator<Boolean,T> rollbackOnCompleteOperator()
        Rolls back current transaction on the completion of source if and only if the source sequence is non-empty.
        Returns:
        operator that rolls back on completion of source.

      • beginTransactionOnNextOperator

        public <T> rx.Observable.Operator<T,T> beginTransactionOnNextOperator()
        Starts a database transaction for each onNext call. Following database calls will be subscribed on current thread (Schedulers.trampoline()) and share the same Connection until transaction is rolled back or committed.
        Returns:
        begin transaction operator

      • commitOnNextOperator

        public rx.Observable.Operator<Boolean,Object> commitOnNextOperator()
        Commits the currently open transaction. Emits true.
        Returns:

      • commitOnNextListOperator

      • rollbackOnNextListOperator

      • rollbackOnNextOperator

        public rx.Observable.Operator<Boolean,?> rollbackOnNextOperator()
        Rolls back the current transaction. Emits false.
        Returns:
